title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. XXIV, subch. D, art. 2, pt. 1271 - Aircraft
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. XXIV, subch. D, art. 2, pt. 1271 - Aircraft

State Regulations
§ 1271.1 - Airport operator may prohibit aircraft from landing or taking off under certain circumstances
§ 1271.2 - Compliance with FAA and CAB rules and regulations required
§ 1271.3 - Careless, negligent or drunken operation of aircraft prohibited
§ 1271.4 - Compliance with orders, signals and directives of airport operator required
§ 1271.5 - Brakes and functioning two-way radio required on all aircraft
§ 1271.6 - Permission to land or take off motorless aircraft required
§ 1271.7 - Permission to land or take off jet or turbo-prop aircraft required
§ 1271.8 - Taxiing aircraft where exhaust blast may cause injury or damage prohibited
§ 1271.9 - Starting engines where exhaust blast may cause injury or damage prohibited
§ 1271.10 - Passengers prohibited from entering or exiting aircraft until engines shut down
§ 1271.11 - Starting and warm-ups restricted to designated areas
§ 1271.12 - Permission for jet-assisted take-offs required
§ 1271.13 - Permission for practice landings or take-offs required
§ 1271.14 - Permission for student landings, take-offs or taxiing required
§ 1271.15 - Use of landing areas designated as unsafe prohibited
§ 1271.16 - Aircraft landing required to leave line of traffic promptly
§ 1271.17 - Permission to land, take off or taxi overweight aircraft required
§ 1271.18 - Aircraft to be positioned and taxied so that slip-stream or jet exhaust does not cause injury or damage
§ 1271.19 - Presence of qualified attendant required before starting engine
§ 1271.20 - Aircraft to be started and run by qualified persons only
§ 1271.21 - Aircraft to be taxied by qualified persons only
§ 1271.22 - Moving aircraft to be under control and in contact with tower
§ 1271.23 - Permission to cross highway under aircraft's own power required
§ 1271.24 - Unattended aircraft to be secured in approved manner
§ 1271.25 - Parked or stored aircraft to be moved upon request
§ 1271.26 - Testing of dump valves restricted to designated areas
§ 1271.27 - Taxiing in or out of hangars prohibited
§ 1271.28 - Parked aircraft to show running lights between sunset and sunrise
§ 1271.29 - All moving aircraft to proceed with running lights between sunset and sunrise
§ 1271.30 - Pilots required to report any accident causing injury or damage
§ 1271.31 - Wrecked or disabled aircraft to be promptly removed
§ 1271.32 - Charges for use of terminal to be paid in cash; exceptions
§ 1271.33 - Aircraft subject to detainment for nonpayment of charges
§ 1271.34 - Right reserved to deny use of terminal for violation of rules and regulations
§ 1271.35 - Aircraft to clear runway and hold positions during emergency

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. XXIV, subch. D, art. 2, pt. 1271

Statutory authority: N.Y. Laws 1921, ch. 154, art. VI and
N.J. Laws 1921, ch. 151, consented to by Congress 42 U.S. Stat. 174 [1921]; N.Y. Laws 1922, ch. 43 and N.J. Laws 1922, ch. 9, consented to by Congress 42
U.S. Stat. 822 [1922]
State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
